by mirawonderfulstar

In the aftermath of the apocalypse, Heaven has a test for Aziraphale.

A reversal on the “Crowley gets dragged back to Hell” trope.

summary: And of course, Crowley is now on consecrated ground. So he is like a man on really, really hot sand on the beach. He’s walking...
text: And of course, Crowley is now on consecrated ground. So he is like a man on really, really hot sand on the beach. He’s walking down like “Ow, ow, ow, ow”. I am writing the scene and I thought - it’s David Tennant. There is no other human being I can think of I want to do this scene.
source:
I actually decided I wanted David halfway through episode Three. And every moment after that I was writing Crowley for David. Every moment before that I was writing ‘A Crowley’. It was the scene 1941, in the Blitz, where I realized… I was writing a scene in a church. Aziraphel is in there, there are Nazi spies, he thinks he’s really clever, but he’s not. He’s in all sorts of trouble. And Crowley has to come down the aisle of the church and rescue him. 
Neil Gaiman, SXSW, March 2019 (x)

summary: I didn't watch the whole interview last night but apparently Gabriel thinks that its really weird that Aziraphale likes...
body:
I didn’t watch the whole interview last night but apparently Gabriel thinks that its really weird that Aziraphale likes eating.

I think it’s going to be interesting having that character included, one who is so detached from the earth, who doesn’t understand what the earth has to offer, and therefore places no value in it’s continued existence.

I think he’s going to be an interesting counter to Crowley for Aziraphale, a sort of cold apathetic logic running against a passionate and desperate emotional love for the world.

There’s doing what you’re told, the easy obedience, the not having to think or be responsible for your actions because you’re only following orders.

And there’s doing what you understand to be right, looking at the world around you and refusing to allow others to be harmed, even when it’s hard, even when being a bystander is more comfortable.

Gabriel as a symbol of destructive complacency.

Crowley as a symbol of altruistic love.

There’s doing what you’re told, the easy obedience, the not having to think or be responsible for your actions because you’re only following orders.

summary:
Crowley put the Bentley in gear. 
Then he remembered something. He snapped his fingers. The wheel clamps disappeared. 
“Let’s...
text:
Crowley put the Bentley in gear.
Then he remembered something. He snapped his fingers. The wheel clamps disappeared.
“Let’s have lunch,” he said. “I owe you one from, when was it … ” “Paris, 1793,” said Aziraphale.
“Oh, yes. The Reign of Terror. Was that one of yours, or one of ours?” “Wasn’t it yours?”
“Can’t recall. It was quite a good restaurant, though.”
As they drove past an astonished traffic warden his notebook spontaneously combusted, to Crowley’s amazement.
“I’m pretty certain I didn’t mean to do that,” he said.
Aziraphale blushed. “That was me,” he said.
“I had always thought that your people invented them.”
“Did you? We thought they were yours.” Crowley stared at the smoke in the rearview mirror.
“Come on,” he said. “Let’s do the Ritz.” Crowley had not bothered to book. In his world, table reservations were things that happened to other people.
source: GOOD OMENS Neil Gaiman and Terry Pratchett

reblog.comment: GOOD OMENS Neil Gaiman and Terry Pratchett

summary:
if y’all seen my blog recently, you know i have a new fave character
funnily enough, though, they didn’t leave a particularly...
body:
how Pollution is described

if y’all seen my blog recently, you know i have a new fave character

funnily enough, though, they didn’t leave a particularly huge impression on me from the trailer(s) [upon rewatch obviously they did but not immediately]… when i (finally) took to the book i really fell in love with them.

so i will in the following list the ways they (i know it says ‘he’ in the book but for the show they’re announced to be nonbinary, so that’s what i’m sticking with) are described in Good Omens; i’ll try to briefly recap their behavior and the effects they have on their surroundings as well as adjectives and adverbs used to define them. i’ll try to combine into a few bigger Points…

[Disclaimer: I tried to remove he/him pronouns and words like ‘man’ or ‘boy’ whenever possible (as well as 1 reference to ‘pale skin’), but it didn’t always make sense so forgive the bits i left in please]

1) the way they talk and behave

  • they ‘whisper’ and ‘breathe’ = talk softly
  • they say things ‘helpfully’ (yes i’m choosing to interpret them naming the exact bible verses the Horsepersons were first described in as trying to actually be helpful and not obnoxious/annoying, they are… too genuine for that)
  • they ‘smile wistfully’
  • they are described as ‘loving’ when interacting with electronics - 'He laid loving hands on a bank of relays […]’
  • in their true form (or smth close too it) their skin ‘glistens’, they look like they’re ‘melting’, walk but they’re ‘oozing’, and when they run they ‘flow quickly’
  • their transformed voice is ‘as insidious as something leaking out of a corroded drum into a water table’

2) the way they are described physically

  • hair either ‘faded blonde’ or just white and long, ‘eyes light grey’
  • somewhere in their twenties
  • ‘almost entirely unmemorable‘
  • ‘unobtrusive; his presence was cumulative‘
  • ‘a hippie, by the look of him‘
  • thin (’[Death] looked over Pollution’s skinny shoulder.’)
  • also, they are disproportionally often referred to as ‘young man’ or ‘boy’ by others as well as the narrative, which makes sense maybe given their appearance… but i think they might actually be the youngest of the Horsepersons? or at least, the newest to the trade, as they only joined up in 1936 (!), and the others appear to have existed for .. almost 6000 years?

3) their interests

  • oil on water (obviously) - ‘’So beautiful. It’s all so damn beautiful.’’
  • polluted sunrises and thunderstorms - ‘’Lovely weather for it.’’
  • loud things?? they like the alarm bells in the air base, and upon picturing the dawn of the Apocalypse, remark ‘’I thought there’d be trumpets.’’
  • travels/cities?? whole quote: ‘’There’s an Armageddon, Pennsylvania. Or maybe it’s Massachusetts, or one of them places. Lots of guys in heavy bears and seriously black hats.’’ and: ‘’I think I went there once. The old city of Megiddo. Just before it fell down. Nice place. Interesting royal gateway.’’
  • chemical as opposed to nuclear weapons - ‘‘Thousands of gallons of stuff in… little tanks all over the world. Beautiful liquids… with eighteen syllables in their names. And the… old standbys. Say what you like. Plutonium may give you grief for thousands of years, but arsenic is forever.‘‘

4) their abilities + misc.

  • ‘He’d taken over when Pestilence, muttering about penicillin, had retired in 1936. If only the old boy had known what opportunities the future had held… ‘
  • ‘[Of] course Pollution laughed at absolutely foolproof, fail-safe devices.’
  • ‘[A] bank of relays […] fused under his touch, and [[they]] introduced a swath of self-replicating viruses that whirred away on the electronic ether.‘
  • their death / disintegration: ‘This time the explosion was a red flame inside a billow of black smoke, and it smelled of oil.’ and: ‘[The crown] glistened in a way that metal should not.’

5) what happens around them

  • ‘The pen developed a leak as he [wrote], and his signature obliterated itself as it was written. It was a long word, and it began with a P, and then there was a splodge, and then it ended in something that might have been -ence, that might have been -ution.’
  • ‘[The] man in white opened the parcel. In it was a crown - a circlet of white metal, set with diamonds. He gazed at it for some seconds, with satisfaction, then put it on. It glinted in the light of the rising sun. Then the tarnish, which had begun to suffuse its silver surface when his fingers touched it, spread to cover it completely, and the crown went black.’
  • ‘A young man in dusty white leathers entered, and the wind blew empty crisp packets and newspapers and ice cream wrappers in with him. They danced around his feet like excited children, then fell exhausted to the floor.’
  • ‘[All cups and spoons] seemed suddenly to have been coated in a light film of motor oil and dried egg.’
  • ‘Beneath his bike an oil slick puddled a rainbow on the wet road.‘

and bonus, because I can (and bc it’s the cutest sh*t like, ever):

  • 'Young man’, [Tyler] said, 'how would you feel if I came over to your house and dropped litter everywhere?’
    Pollution smiled, wistfully. 'Very, very pleased’, he breathed. 'Oh, that would be wonderful.’

reblog.comment:

  • ‘[The] man in white opened the parcel. In it was a crown - a circlet of white metal, set with diamonds. He gazed at it for some seconds, with satisfaction, then put it on. It glinted in the light of the rising sun. Then the tarnish, which had begun to suffuse its silver surface when his fingers touched it, spread to cover it completely, and the crown went black.’
  • ‘A young man in dusty white leathers entered, and the wind blew empty crisp packets and newspapers and ice cream wrappers in with him. They danced around his feet like excited children, then fell exhausted to the floor.’

  • ‘Beneath his bike an oil slick puddled a rainbow on the wet road.‘

  • 'Young man’, [Tyler] said, 'how would you feel if I came over to your house and dropped litter everywhere?’
    Pollution smiled, wistfully. 'Very, very pleased’, he breathed. 'Oh, that would be wonderful.’

  • they ‘smile wistfully’
  • they are described as ‘loving’ when interacting with electronics - 'He laid loving hands on a bank of relays […]’
  • in their true form (or smth close too it) their skin ‘glistens’, they look like they’re ‘melting’, walk but they’re ‘oozing’, and when they run they ‘flow quickly’
  • their transformed voice is ‘as insidious as something leaking out of a corroded drum into a water table’

2) the way they are described physically

  • hair either ‘faded blonde’ or just white and long, ‘eyes light grey’
  • somewhere in their twenties
  • ‘almost entirely unmemorable‘
  • ‘unobtrusive; his presence was cumulative‘
  • ‘a hippie, by the look of him‘
  • thin (’[Death] looked over Pollution’s skinny shoulder.’)
  • also, they are disproportionally often referred to as ‘young man’ or ‘boy’ by others as well as the narrative, which makes sense maybe given their appearance… but i think they might actually be the youngest of the Horsepersons? or at least, the newest to the trade, as they only joined up in 1936 (!), and the others appear to have existed for .. almost 6000 years?

3) their interests

  • oil on water (obviously) - ‘’So beautiful. It’s all so damn beautiful.’’
  • polluted sunrises and thunderstorms - ‘’Lovely weather for it.’’
  • loud things?? they like the alarm bells in the air base, and upon picturing the dawn of the Apocalypse, remark ‘’I thought there’d be trumpets.’’
  • travels/cities?? whole quote: ‘’There’s an Armageddon, Pennsylvania. Or maybe it’s Massachusetts, or one of them places. Lots of guys in heavy bears and seriously black hats.’’ and: ‘’I think I went there once. The old city of Megiddo. Just before it fell down. Nice place. Interesting royal gateway.’’
  • chemical as opposed to nuclear weapons - ‘‘Thousands of gallons of stuff in… little tanks all over the world. Beautiful liquids… with eighteen syllables in their names. And the… old standbys. Say what you like. Plutonium may give you grief for thousands of years, but arsenic is forever.‘‘

4) their abilities + misc.

  • ‘He’d taken over when Pestilence, muttering about penicillin, had retired in 1936. If only the old boy had known what opportunities the future had held… ‘
  • ‘[Of] course Pollution laughed at absolutely foolproof, fail-safe devices.’
  • ‘[A] bank of relays […] fused under his touch, and [[they]] introduced a swath of self-replicating viruses that whirred away on the electronic ether.‘
  • their death / disintegration: ‘This time the explosion was a red flame inside a billow of black smoke, and it smelled of oil.’ and: ‘[The crown] glistened in a way that metal should not.’

5) what happens around them

  • ‘The pen developed a leak as he [wrote], and his signature obliterated itself as it was written. It was a long word, and it began with a P, and then there was a splodge, and then it ended in something that might have been -ence, that might have been -ution.’
  • ‘[The] man in white opened the parcel. In it was a crown - a circlet of white metal, set with diamonds. He gazed at it for some seconds, with satisfaction, then put it on. It glinted in the light of the rising sun. Then the tarnish, which had begun to suffuse its silver surface when his fingers touched it, spread to cover it completely, and the crown went black.’
  • ‘A young man in dusty white leathers entered, and the wind blew empty crisp packets and newspapers and ice cream wrappers in with him. They danced around his feet like excited children, then fell exhausted to the floor.’
  • ‘[All cups and spoons] seemed suddenly to have been coated in a light film of motor oil and dried egg.’
  • ‘Beneath his bike an oil slick puddled a rainbow on the wet road.‘

and bonus, because I can (and bc it’s the cutest sh*t like, ever):

  • 'Young man’, [Tyler] said, 'how would you feel if I came over to your house and dropped litter everywhere?’
    Pollution smiled, wistfully. 'Very, very pleased’, he breathed. 'Oh, that would be wonderful.’
trail.content:
how Pollution is described

if y’all seen my blog recently, you know i have a new fave character

funnily enough, though, they didn’t leave a particularly huge impression on me from the trailer(s) [upon rewatch obviously they did but not immediately]… when i (finally) took to the book i really fell in love with them.

so i will in the following list the ways they (i know it says ‘he’ in the book but for the show they’re announced to be nonbinary, so that’s what i’m sticking with) are described in Good Omens; i’ll try to briefly recap their behavior and the effects they have on their surroundings as well as adjectives and adverbs used to define them. i’ll try to combine into a few bigger Points…

[Disclaimer: I tried to remove he/him pronouns and words like ‘man’ or ‘boy’ whenever possible (as well as 1 reference to ‘pale skin’), but it didn’t always make sense so forgive the bits i left in please]

1) the way they talk and behave

  • they ‘whisper’ and ‘breathe’ = talk softly
  • they say things ‘helpfully’ (yes i’m choosing to interpret them naming the exact bible verses the Horsepersons were first described in as trying to actually be helpful and not obnoxious/annoying, they are… too genuine for that)
  • they ‘smile wistfully’
  • they are described as ‘loving’ when interacting with electronics - 'He laid loving hands on a bank of relays […]’
  • in their true form (or smth close too it) their skin ‘glistens’, they look like they’re ‘melting’, walk but they’re ‘oozing’, and when they run they ‘flow quickly’
  • their transformed voice is ‘as insidious as something leaking out of a corroded drum into a water table’

2) the way they are described physically

  • hair either ‘faded blonde’ or just white and long, ‘eyes light grey’
  • somewhere in their twenties
  • ‘almost entirely unmemorable‘
  • ‘unobtrusive; his presence was cumulative‘
  • ‘a hippie, by the look of him‘
  • thin (’[Death] looked over Pollution’s skinny shoulder.’)
  • also, they are disproportionally often referred to as ‘young man’ or ‘boy’ by others as well as the narrative, which makes sense maybe given their appearance… but i think they might actually be the youngest of the Horsepersons? or at least, the newest to the trade, as they only joined up in 1936 (!), and the others appear to have existed for .. almost 6000 years?

3) their interests

  • oil on water (obviously) - ‘’So beautiful. It’s all so damn beautiful.’’
  • polluted sunrises and thunderstorms - ‘’Lovely weather for it.’’
  • loud things?? they like the alarm bells in the air base, and upon picturing the dawn of the Apocalypse, remark ‘’I thought there’d be trumpets.’’
  • travels/cities?? whole quote: ‘’There’s an Armageddon, Pennsylvania. Or maybe it’s Massachusetts, or one of them places. Lots of guys in heavy bears and seriously black hats.’’ and: ‘’I think I went there once. The old city of Megiddo. Just before it fell down. Nice place. Interesting royal gateway.’’
  • chemical as opposed to nuclear weapons - ‘‘Thousands of gallons of stuff in… little tanks all over the world. Beautiful liquids… with eighteen syllables in their names. And the… old standbys. Say what you like. Plutonium may give you grief for thousands of years, but arsenic is forever.‘‘

4) their abilities + misc.

  • ‘He’d taken over when Pestilence, muttering about penicillin, had retired in 1936. If only the old boy had known what opportunities the future had held… ‘
  • ‘[Of] course Pollution laughed at absolutely foolproof, fail-safe devices.’
  • ‘[A] bank of relays […] fused under his touch, and [[they]] introduced a swath of self-replicating viruses that whirred away on the electronic ether.‘
  • their death / disintegration: ‘This time the explosion was a red flame inside a billow of black smoke, and it smelled of oil.’ and: ‘[The crown] glistened in a way that metal should not.’

5) what happens around them

  • ‘The pen developed a leak as he [wrote], and his signature obliterated itself as it was written. It was a long word, and it began with a P, and then there was a splodge, and then it ended in something that might have been -ence, that might have been -ution.’
  • ‘[The] man in white opened the parcel. In it was a crown - a circlet of white metal, set with diamonds. He gazed at it for some seconds, with satisfaction, then put it on. It glinted in the light of the rising sun. Then the tarnish, which had begun to suffuse its silver surface when his fingers touched it, spread to cover it completely, and the crown went black.’
  • ‘A young man in dusty white leathers entered, and the wind blew empty crisp packets and newspapers and ice cream wrappers in with him. They danced around his feet like excited children, then fell exhausted to the floor.’
  • ‘[All cups and spoons] seemed suddenly to have been coated in a light film of motor oil and dried egg.’
  • ‘Beneath his bike an oil slick puddled a rainbow on the wet road.‘

and bonus, because I can (and bc it’s the cutest sh*t like, ever):

  • 'Young man’, [Tyler] said, 'how would you feel if I came over to your house and dropped litter everywhere?’
    Pollution smiled, wistfully. 'Very, very pleased’, he breathed. 'Oh, that would be wonderful.’

summary:
Is that circular Gallifreyan on Aziraphale’s gown?
OK, correct me if I’m wrong, and I very well could be, BUT-
At SXSW, Neil...
body:
Is that circular Gallifreyan on Aziraphale’s gown?

OK, correct me if I’m wrong, and I very well could be, BUT-

At SXSW, Neil Gaiman said that there will be Easter Eggs and goodies galore for those who have read the books and a bonus for ‘Doctor Who’ fans: there are approximately seven to eight ‘Doctor Who’ Easter eggs across the six episodes.

‘Season one of Good Omens is Good Omens’ | Neil Gaiman says show won’t have more than 6 episodes

https://www.kvue.com/article/news/season-one-of-good-omens-is-good-omens-neil-gaiman-says-show-wont-have-more-than-6-episodes/269-cae9b363-b2ee-4780-a94a-4ce9491c59ed

summary: hot take, and this is not meant as an insult to mr. hamm or the lesbians just now discovering him: gabriel is being marketed as...
body: hot take, and this is not meant as an insult to mr. hamm or the lesbians just now discovering him: gabriel is being marketed as a major good omens character by amazon bc they’re trying to market to a wider, more heterosexual audience and it’s fucking hilarious bc i’ll bet he’s in the show for about 10-15 minutes tops

body: the thing about crowley saying “to the world,” crowley saying it, shows that he’s grown so much because he’s finally able to unabashedly love. and the look aziraphale gives him is like. it;s . i was coherent but now im not becos aziraphale is just like . god . hes like “i love you and im so PROUD of you.” ugh
